comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Hmmm - this must be a VERY early Hall photo. The 'La Hogue' was already a coal-hulk in Madeira by 1887 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/13650792 (full of purple prose).

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: So if it not the LA HOGUE, what is it? Post 1895 due to the McBurney Wallis & Co warehouse (thanks to [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02]).

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] One Flickr mystery solved, another appears! Will look around for any Hall pics of a similar time/ place.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
